com.rolledback.mapping

Class Cartographer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rolledback.mapping.Cartographer

  • public class Cartographer
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the reading and writing of .map files. Documentation concerning the format of .map files can be found in the readme file. In general, maps begin with a "magic number" of ox6D. After that the next byte contains the tile size (pixels for each tile). This byte is actually not currently used or even returned, but it is included in the file because of the potential for its use in the future. The next 4 bytes contain the width and height of the map, 2 each, in that order. Following those, there are (width*height) bytes, each byte representing a tile.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matthew Rayermann (rolledback, www.github.com/rolledback, www.cs.utexas.edu/~mrayer)

    • Method Detail

      • readMapFile

        public static java.lang.Object[] readMapFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                             Tile[][] tiles,
                             World w)
        Opens a file and reads in the values. Makes sure that the file is properlly formatted.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the file to be opened
        tiles - tiles matrix that the map is to be loaded into
        w - dummy world used in the byteToTile function
        Returns:
        an array of objects. If the file is inproperly formatted/an error is thrown, then the array will only contain a false value in the 0th index. If the file is correct, then the array will contain a true, the tiles matrix, the width, and then the height.

      • createMapFile

        public static boolean createMapFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                    Tile[][] tiles,
                    int tileSize)
        Creates a map file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the map file to be created. The .map part has to be included in the string.
        tiles - the tiles matrix to be written to the file
        tileSize - tile size in pixels
        Returns:
        boolean which represents if the file was successfully created.

      • tileToByte

        public static byte tileToByte(Tile tile)
        Converts a tile to it's byte code. Based on the tiles image.
        Parameters:
        tile - the tile to be converted.
        Returns:
        the byte value of the tile.

      • byteToTile

        public static Tile byteToTile(World w,
              byte value,
              int col,
              int row)
        Converts a tile to byte code.
        Parameters:
        w - world for the tiles to be put in.
        value - byte code value to be converted.
        col - column position of the tile.
        row - row position of the tile.
        Returns:
        fully constructed tile to placed into a world's tile matrix.

      • getDimensions

        public static int[] getDimensions(java.lang.String name)
        Returns only the dimensions of a .map file. Still performs the check for the magic number.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the file to read.
        Returns:
        int array containing the dimensions of the map. If an error is thrown or the magic number is not found then simply returns an array with a 0 only.
